item.title: Moscow - Wikipedia
item.description: In 1992, the Moscow government began planning a projected new part of central Moscow, the Moscow International Business Center, with the goal of creating a zone, the first in Russia, and in all of Eastern Europe, [254] that will combine business activity, living space and entertainment.

item.title: Moscow | History, Geography, Population, & Map | Britannica
item.description: Moscow, city, capital of Russia since the late 13th century. It is not only the political center of Russia but also the country’s most populous city and its industrial, cultural, scientific, and educational capital.

item.title: THE 15 BEST Things to Do in Moscow (2026) - Tripadvisor
item.description: See what other travelers like to do, based on ratings and number of bookings. These rankings are informed by Tripadvisor data—we consider traveler reviews, ratings, number of page views, and user location. 1. Red Square is a city square in Moscow, Russia.

item.title: 30 Best Things to do in Moscow Russia 2026 | Holidify
item.description: See most popular tourist places to visit in Moscow, top things to do, shopping and nightlife in Moscow, find entry timings, fees about various attractions in Moscow, Russia

item.title: Moscow - New World Encyclopedia
item.description: Historically, it was the capital of the former Soviet Union and the Grand Duchy of Moscow, the pre-Imperial Russian state. It is the site of the Kremlin, which now serves as the ceremonial residence of the President of Russia. Moscow is world-renowned for its architecture and its performing arts.

item.title: Moscow – Travel guide at Wikivoyage
item.description: Moscow is the second most populous city in Europe, after Istanbul, and has the most populous metropolitan area in Europe, with some 21 million residents, comprising roughly one-seventh of the population of Russia. Moscow is in the UTC+3 time zone; there is no daylight saving time.

item.title: Moscow Travel Guide - National Geographic
item.description: Its Cold War history and massive size might give it an intimidating image, but at its core Moscow is every bit the European city offering wealth of history and culture coupled with modernity and...

item.title: Moscow - Wikiwand
item.description: Moscow is the capital and largest city of Russia, standing on the Moskva River in Central Russia. It has a population estimated at over 13 million residents wit...

item.title: Visit Moscow, sightseeing guide - VisitRussia
item.description: The most comprehensive information on travel to Moscow. Top Moscow attractions, things to do, unique tours.

item.title: Moscow - Wikitravel
item.description: Moscow has several world-class theatres (Bolshoi, Maly, Moscow Art Theatre, to name a few), and it is definitely worth planning a visit to one of them, although it is neither easy, nor cheap.
